job_tasks.phrase: fully immerse yourself in the context of the business in order to come up with the best solution to the challenge
job_tasks.justification: This phrase directly indicates the need to understand the business context to formulate solutions.

job_tasks.phrase: Meet with stakeholders and subject matter experts to gain a better understanding of the underlying business problem and the requirements
job_tasks.justification: This highlights interaction with business stakeholders to grasp business problems and requirements.

job_tasks.phrase: The answers to these questions directly influence the operations of KLM, which means plenty of opportunities to work on projects that truly save costs, increase customer satisfaction and revenue.
job_tasks.justification: This emphasizes the direct impact of the work on business operations, cost savings, and revenue, indicating a focus on business outcomes.

job_tasks.phrase: Be a reliable partner for the business: ensuring robust, tested code, quality control, as well as maintaining existing solutions.
job_tasks.justification: This points to the need to be a dependable partner for the business, aligning technical work with business needs and maintaining solutions.

job_tasks.phrase: Perform exploratory data analysis to assess data quality and gain important insights
job_tasks.justification: This task involves analyzing data to understand its quality and extract insights, a fundamental part of data preparation.

job_tasks.phrase: Perform feature engineering, be creative and combine new sources with the traditional data warehouses or our vast data lakes to increase model performance
job_tasks.justification: This explicitly mentions feature engineering and combining data sources, which are core data engineering activities.

job_tasks.phrase: work closely together with other data teams that are specialized in areas like Data Engineering and Data Governance
job_tasks.justification: This indicates collaboration with dedicated data engineering functions, reinforcing the importance of data preparation.

job_tasks.phrase: Work on prediction models, which are used in KLM live customer interactions 24/7.
job_tasks.justification: This directly states the work involves 'prediction models'.

job_tasks.phrase: Research and choose an appropriate set of potential models and loss functions that align with the problem and discuss validation strategies with your fellow data scientists
job_tasks.justification: This describes the process of selecting, validating, and discussing ML models.

job_tasks.phrase: Execute experiments while logging your model's metrics, parameters and metadata to a model registry for easy sharing and reproducibility
job_tasks.justification: This involves conducting experiments and managing model artifacts, which are key to the modeling lifecycle.

job_tasks.phrase: Maintain and/or improve your model through monitoring, re-training, adding new features etc.
job_tasks.justification: This describes ongoing model management, including re-training and improvement.

job_tasks.phrase: Put ML use cases into production, adopting a practical and pragmatic mindset.
job_tasks.justification: This involves the actual deployment and productionization of ML models.

job_tasks.phrase: Can we use GenAI models to prevent revenue leakage during our invoicing process?
job_tasks.justification: This question explicitly mentions 'GenAI models', indicating a focus on generative AI for a specific business problem.

job_tasks.phrase: Put your model into production, and work together with engineers inside and outside of the team to ensure company-wide production standards are met
job_tasks.justification: This involves integrating models into production systems and collaborating with engineers, indicating software development aspects.

job_tasks.phrase: Guide our upcoming transition to the cloud: Identify requirements and improvements, communicate them to relevant parties
job_tasks.justification: This involves understanding and communicating technical requirements for cloud transition, which relates to software architecture and deployment.

job_tasks.phrase: Determine how Data Science requirements translate to architectural components and way of working
job_tasks.justification: This requires translating data science needs into software architecture and operational frameworks.

job_tasks.phrase: Be a reliable partner for the business: ensuring robust, tested code, quality control, as well as maintaining existing solutions.
job_tasks.justification: Ensuring robust, tested code and quality control are core software development practices.

job_tasks.phrase: Execute experiments while logging your model's metrics, parameters and metadata to a model registry for easy sharing and reproducibility
job_tasks.justification: Logging metrics, parameters, and metadata to a model registry is a MLOps practice for reproducibility.

job_tasks.phrase: Put your model into production, and work together with engineers inside and outside of the team to ensure company-wide production standards are met
job_tasks.justification: Putting models into production and ensuring production standards aligns with MLOps responsibilities.

job_tasks.phrase: Maintain and/or improve your model through monitoring, re-training, adding new features etc.
job_tasks.justification: Monitoring and re-training models in production are key MLOps tasks.

job_tasks.phrase: Put ML use cases into production, adopting a practical and pragmatic mindset.
job_tasks.justification: Productionizing ML use cases is a core MLOps activity.

soft_skills.phrase: Meet with stakeholders and subject matter experts to gain a better understanding of the underlying business problem and the requirements
discuss validation strategies with your fellow data scientists
work together with engineers inside and outside of the team
work closely together with other data teams
work closely with our contacts in the business
Be a reliable partner for the business
Coach junior/medior data scientists & ML Engineers
spending 15-20% of your time with us learning new things, doing research and developing yourself.
The projects you do in your 15-20% developing time must be related to your role, but do not have to be related to the projects you normally work on.
come up with the best solution to the challenge
be creative and combine new sources with the traditional data warehouses or our vast data lakes to increase model performance
Put ML use cases into production, adopting a practical and pragmatic mindset.
be creative and combine new sources with the traditional data warehouses or our vast data lakes to increase model performance

classification.rationale: The role heavily emphasizes traditional ML tasks such as 'prediction models', 'feature engineering', 'model training', and 'validation strategies'. While 'GenAI models' are mentioned in a specific use case, the overall focus and explicit responsibilities lean towards building, deploying, and maintaining predictive models in production, aligning more closely with the ML Engineer profile.
